intro: ^, come here. I want to show you something. My granddaughter Brooklyn is coming to visit. She drew a picture of all the things she wants to do in Bloomwood."

s: ^Hello Mr. Calindas, this is so sweet. Wait. Is that a unicorn?

Chat1: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "It is! She says she loves unicorns, even though they don't exist. She loves animals and knows many little facts about them. This is Jessica's oldest, you know."

s: ^I'm really excited to see her. I sadly don't have a unicorn up my sleeve.
^Hey Mr. Calindas! This is so cute, how old is Brooklyn now?

Chat2: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "If you did, she'd love you forever. I'm actually a bit worried about her visit. It's exciting, but she's autistic, and changes to her routine can be hard."

s: ^Oh, really? How old is Brooklyn now?
^My cousin is autistic. He really thrives with routine and predictability.

QuestIntro: ^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Brooklyn is 9. She's such a determined little girl; now that we know that autism is why she struggles with some things, we have better tools for her."
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Jessica is nervous about her staying with us for a whole week, but she has a work commitment, and I think we are a better childcare option than hiring someone."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling  "Brooklyn and my mother are best buddies. I think it will be good for both of them. Maybe not for my nerves - who knows what trouble they're going to cause!"
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "I would love to know what resources exist in Bloomwood to help us make her feel comfortable and welcome."

s: ^Hmm. Possibly, can you tell me more about what Brooklyn needs?

QuestDetails1: ^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Of course! This is an act of faith - in all of us - on Jessica's part. I know that Brooklyn needs understanding adults who know how to respond to her sensory needs."
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "She knows she's different; what I want is to make sure she doesn't feel badly for that."
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "I was also hoping there might be some kid-friendly events coming up that might be accessible to people with different disabilities."

s: ^Can you be specific about some of the needs Brooklyn has?
^Okay, I think I can try and find some tips!

QuestDetails2: ^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Oh yes. Sometimes the sounds of everything can make her ears hurt. Also, if there's a lot going on and no way to step back, sometimes she can feel very overstimulated."
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Knowing more about the possible activities can help us prepare."

s: ^Brooklyn is such a great kid. I'll see what I can find out!

QuestAcceptance: ^. I appreciate you helping me plan ahead."

s: ^Well, I can't promise a unicorn, but I promise that I'll do what I can.

Goodbye: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "We can always count on you to do your best,
^. Anything you can find for us, will help us out a lot. Okay, I am going to head back to work. Enjoy the sunshine!"

s: ^I'll try and soak some in. I'll be back soon!
